reviews.review:
About reviews...
How are those checklist format reviews helpful at all? I keep seeing more and more of them pop up and they keep getting to the top of store pages as "most helpful" when they really don't say anything. Here is an example:

---{ Graphics }---
‚òê You forget what reality is
‚òê Beautiful
‚òê Good
‚òê Decent
‚òê Bad
‚òê Don‚Äòt look too long at it
‚òë MS-DOS

---{ Gameplay }---
‚òê Very good
‚òë Good
‚òê It's just gameplay
‚òê Mehh
‚òê Watch paint dry instead
‚òê Just don't

---{ Audio }---
‚òê Eargasm
‚òê Very good
‚òê Good
‚òë Not too bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê I'm now deaf

---{ Audience }---
‚òë Kids
‚òë Teens
‚òë Adults
‚òê Grandma

---{ PC Requirements }---
‚òê Check if you can run paint
‚òë Potato
‚òê Decent
‚òê Fast
‚òê Rich boi
‚òê Ask NASA if they have a spare computer

---{ Difficulty }---
‚òê Just press 'W'
‚òê Easy
‚òë Easy to learn / Hard to master
‚òê Significant brain usage
‚òê Difficult
‚òê Dark Souls

---{ Grind }---
‚òë Nothing to grind
‚òê Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks
‚òê Isn't necessary to progress
‚òê Average grind level
‚òê Too much grind
‚òê You'll need a second live for grinding

---{ Story }---
‚òë No Story
‚òê Some lore
‚òê Average
‚òê Good
‚òê Lovely
‚òê It'll replace your life

---{ Game Time }---
‚òê Long enough for a cup of coffee
‚òê Short
‚òê Average
‚òê Long
‚òë To infinity and beyond

---{ Price }---
‚òê It's free!
‚òê Worth the price
‚òë If it's on sale
‚òê If u have some spare money left
‚òê Not recommended
‚òê You could also just burn your money

---{ Bugs }---
‚òê Never heard of
‚òë Minor bugs
‚òê Can get annoying
‚òê ARK: Survival Evolved
‚òê The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

---{ ? / 10 }---
‚òê 1
‚òê 2
‚òê 3
‚òê 4
‚òê 5
‚òê 6
‚òê 7
‚òê 8
‚òê 9
‚òë 10

Based on the information provided, can you guess what game this review is for? What's it about? What kind of game is it?

Point is, these reviews are completely interchangeable. I bet if you took this exact review, and copy and pasted it to every game in your library, you'd get the top review for half of the games you put it on, even if you didn't change the check marks to fit each individual game.

In my opinion, the Steam community should stop encouraging this format and instead downvote them all into oblivion. Maybe it's just me, and I guess it's not THAT big a deal, but for someone that puts at least some effort into the reviews they write, it is a little disheartening that the steam community prefers lazy checklists that ultimately don't say anything specific about the games in question. Plus I don't see how they could ever actually influence someone's decision to purchase a game or not when so little information is given.

Anyone agree or am I the only one that wants to read legitimately helpful reviews for games I might be interested in?

10/10
I'm having a stroke as i write this.

I've been playing this off and on since about 2001 or so for perhaps 4x as many hours as this Steam profile indicates. Graphics are dated, gameplay is simple, the learning curve can be punishing for new (also to CS) players, servers are few and the player base is small. However, the community is both tight and warm to newcomers and returning players. I've made several friendly acquaintances and "DoD buddies" on here. When a server gets going, it's a wondrous display of bullets and mayhem not unlike any other well-designed shooter. Among the servers that still run, some have great vanilla and modded maps with often interesting adjustments. There's a class/gun and playing style for everyone, regardless of skill or playing background. When there are only a few players on a map, it feels like a duel where the stakes are high and where you alone can turn the tide and when it's full, it feels like a proper skirmish, where everyone contributes their piece but where the group is more important than the individual. Both have their distinct charms. Personally, I find the bot servers  ( players only vs bots only) more enjoyable - though I'm very decent in PvP - because they're the closest thing to ideal co-op gameplay in a FPS landscape where everyone's out for themselves. Instead, tactics matter, communication is king, support is reassuringly given and returned, and you truly feel like a team.

Again, the game may be old...
...but newer is not always better.

this game may actually be better than the source remake. the graphics are pretty good, they give out a pretty nostalgic feeling. the weapons are all pretty good, it's not laggy, and so on. it's a pretty great game and i think more people should play it.

From the good old days of goldsource

This game is lots of fun as a pick up and have fun type of game. There's a few servers with good bots so you can always play if you don't wanna deal with the skilled clan players or insanely drunk college students. Great game for $5.
el primer juego que me engancho on line
I have had some of the best times of my childhood playing this game

very fun, kinda like a ww2-themed hl and hl2 mod, like the ww2 version of the more modernized counter-strike and counter-strike source which are also  hl and hl2 mods. Gameplay-wise and for whatever sake of story driven aesthetic fps's can have, I prefer DoD over cs since cs 1.6 and dod 1.3, in the sequels as well, I've always prefered DoD source gamplay than CS source gamplay, and I've played a lot of CS probably more than DoD overall. I am a better DoD player than CS player it just happens I took more interest when I was younger (14-19) which was kinda pointless considering it's a lot less fun when you're less skilled at understanding the map positions and weapons + harnessing fast and accurate crosshair movement and predictive tracing for appearing enemies, etc. Cs has less predictable and accurate bullet trajectory in both rifles and smg's and doesn't really have mountable MG's or plantable explosives other than the bomb itself based around the entire game mode where T's plant a bomb and CT's have to defuse within certain amount of minutes & can purchase defuse kits in their loadout shop for faster defusing and winning the round for CT. Great game, I'm just a huge nerd for ww2 and ww2 guns but thought cs was were all the kids in school were playing on pc owners.

This game was my life as a 10 and 12 year old. I remember playing it for hours on end. After close to 20 years I download it again and wow, the nostalgia and the graphics of 2003. Very impressive. The game play is outstanding. For its time, this game was a pioneer in WW2 multiplayer shooters. I still fire it up to get that experience. If you want to see what us old heads grew up on, download it and give it a chance.

A lesser known Valve game that started out as Half-Life mod that‚Äôs worth playing at least once.

Best game on steam. Servers still up! Nice community

Day of Defeat is a great and underrated WW2 FPS game by Valve. In the game, there are two teams, namely German Army and Allied troops. In each team, there are several classes with their own strengths and weaknesses. In addition, there are still a few active servers out there and most of the players are friendly, so the game's not really dead.

In conclusion, if you like old school WW2 games, then this game is for you.

Unfortunately Day of Defeat is mostly a dead game but man is it fun to go into the time machine and play one of the first shooters I played as a kid. The review is a positive one because it is critically a fun and enjoyable game but unfortunately I cannot recommend this game anymore because there are often only 1-2 servers running for gameplay and I simply can't justify recommending someone to buy this game anymore.
